definition: A standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser.
A style sheet language used for describing the look and formatting of a document written in HTML.
A programming language that enables interactive web pages.
A set of rules that allow programs to talk to each other.
A lightweight data-interchange format that is easy for humans to read and write.
A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine.
A package manager for JavaScript, as well as a marketplace for sharing and borrowing packages.
A fast, reliable, and secure dependency management tool.
A JavaScript library for building user interfaces.
A progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces.
